content:
is permissible for a physician to administer to a patient mor-
phine sufficient (although no more than sufficient) to control his pain even if
she foresees that the morphine will result in his death. Notice how nicely the
FLO account of the wrongness of killing explains this unanimity of opinion.
A patient  known  to  be  in  severe  intractable  pain  is  presumed  to  have  a  
future without positive value. Accordingly, death would not be a misfortune
for  him  and  an  action  that  would  (
